skillTree.localised_description: The tribes hold no compunction about merging with others to form alliances  one moment, or breaking pacts in the next. Likewise, tribesmen will be quick to abandon a cowardly khan.
“Take them! Cut them down and their gold and women will be yours!”
To rise to a position of leadership among the Hung requires strength and cunning…and a good knife on hand.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one’s riders are never far; harassers by day, ghosts by night, they wear down the foe without risking the camp.

effects.description:
Enables attrition
	(enemy armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: It’s not glory that feeds an army—it’s grain, trade, and restraint. This commander keeps a tight rein over the gathered tribesmen.

effects.description:
Income from raiding, sacking, and razing: -25%
	(armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: This one digs deep and drills daily; any fool thinking to storm his camp soon regrets it.
This one proclaims his faith as thunderously as the stormy sky, and ensures that the Gathering is likewise dutiful to the gods.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +20 per turn
	(armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: A patient and calculating commander who favors assassination, sabotage, and misdirection. He surrounds himself with spies, poisoners, and cowards made dangerous by ambition.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(characters in circle of influence)

Ambush defence chance: -35%
	(enemy armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: To be trusted with the Khan’s chosen is to be trusted withthe tribe's future; this commander trains champions.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Crafted of many small plates of iron, steel, or leather laced together, this tough armour is both strong and flexible.
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These wandering hunters care only for three things: killing, plundering, and their horses.

effects.description:
Leadership: +3 for Hung Nomads, Hung Spawneaters, Hung Dog Handlers, Hung Scouts, Steppe Trackers, and Light Lancers
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for Hung Nomads, Hung Spawneaters, Hung Dog Handlers, Hung Scouts, Steppe Trackers, and Light Lancers

Melee attack: +4 for Hung Nomads, Hung Spawneaters, Hung Dog Handlers, Hung Scouts, Steppe Trackers, and Light Lancers
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To these, there is no greater pleasure than to fight by the light of a burning town, no finer music than the terrified screams of the innocent and the cowardly.

effects.description:
Leadership: +3 for Hung Pillagers, Hung Raiders, and Hung Ambushers
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Hung Pillagers, Hung Raiders, and Hung Ambushers
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +5% for Hung Pillagers, Hung Raiders, and Hung Ambushers
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +9 for Hung Pillagers, Hung Raiders, and Hung Ambushers
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Hung Pillagers, Hung Raiders, and Hung Ambushers
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To survive on the Eastern Steppes, a tribesman needs a horse and bow. Without these, there is nothing but starvation or death.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +1% per experience rank for archer units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for archer units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The ground shakes, stones dance, and dust rises on the horizon. The savage horde comes.

effects.description:
Leadership: +3 for Hung Heavy Archers, Hung Horsemasters, Heavy Lancers, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Hung Heavy Archers, Hung Horsemasters, Heavy Lancers, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Hung Heavy Archers, Hung Horsemasters, Heavy Lancers, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Hung Heavy Archers, Hung Horsemasters, Heavy Lancers, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Armour: +20 for Hung Heavy Archers, Hung Horsemasters, Heavy Lancers, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows to bring plenty of meat when going to war, for the great centigor herds are ravenous and only momentarily appeased.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Steppe Centigor units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Steppe Centigor units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Steppe Centigor units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Steppe Centigor units

Speed: +15% for Steppe Centigor units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Steppe Centigor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the steppes are both a danger and an asset. This warlord knows how to turn them against the horde’s foes.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +3% for Steppe Vultures, Feral Horse Herd, Chaos Warhounds, Hung Hunting Dogs, Chaos Spawn and Death Worm units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10%  for Steppe Vultures, Feral Horse Herd, Chaos Warhounds, Hung Hunting Dogs, Chaos Spawn and Death Worm units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “Blow the horns! Raise the horsehair banner! We strike their army’s flank!”
Scarred and mutilated, their “beautiful” visages inspire fear among their foes.

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Large: +8 for Dismounted Heavy Archers, Dismounted Horsemasters, and Khevtuul  (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for Dismounted Heavy Archers, Dismounted Horsemasters, and Khevtuul
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +1% per experience rank for Dismounted Heavy Archers, Dismounted Horsemasters, and Khevtuul
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Layers of horn, wood, and monstrous sinew give these compact just as much power as the finest longbow.

effects.description:
Range: +1% per experience rank for Great Centigors (Greatbows) and horse archer units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing missile damage: +1% per experience rank for Great Centigors (Greatbows) and horse archer units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Despite being part of a treacherous and rowdy people, these warriors are a different sort, tempered by battle and fiercely loyal.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +1% per experience rank for Khevtuul, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for Khevtuul, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for Khevtuul, Torguud, and Khan's Guard
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These creatures are mythical inhabitants of the north and east, sacred heralds of the Ruinous Powers.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Steppe Vultures, Death Worm, Centigor Elder, Dark Wind, and Shackled Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Steppe Vultures, Death Worm, Centigor Elder, Dark Wind, and Shackled Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: +10% for Steppe Vultures, Death Worm, Centigor Elder, Dark Wind, and Shackled Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Despite being called a primitive hunter-gatherer by settled races, this warlord is an expert at maneuvering forces across a battlefield.
A rota of sentries is a small but important layer of security for any Gathering.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -25%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Deals struck in the noyan's ger tend to last, though few leave feeling they got the better end of them.

effects.description: Immune to diplomatic penalties from trespassing

skillTree.localised_description: Under his eye, nothing is wasted, and everything finds its proper place, from horseshoes to horsemen.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5%
	(armies in circle of influence)

Recruitment cost: -10%
	(armies in circle of influence)

Recruitment cost: -15%
	(armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: "Give him wool and bones, and he’ll raise a fortress by moonrise."
Where others break and run, this noyan digs in deeper—and dares the enemy to try again.
This noyan has spent time getting acquainted with the locals and learning their ways.
This noyan shapes the idle into iron and turns every campfire gathering into a warband in waiting.
Foreign ground becomes familiar, thanks to a "willing" guide.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10%
	(armies in circle of influence)

Campaign movement range: +15%
	(armies in circle of influence)

Campaign movement range: +20%
	(armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: Raising and preparing the hordes for battle is as much a part of a noyan's responsibilities as keeping order.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(armies in circle of influence)

Casualty replenishment rate: +10%
	(armies in circle of influence)

Casualty replenishment rate: +15%
	(armies in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: Whether through fear, respect, or broken kneecaps, the tribute always arrives on time.
The tribesmen may grumble and groan beneath the noyan's sharp eye, but they thank him for their training with bloodied smiles when the battle is won.

effects.description:
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn (minimum 1)
	(armies in circle of influence)

Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(armies in circle of influence)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Behind every thought they have - and every deed - is shameless, full-blooded spite.
"Some folk call me vicious. I'll scoop out the eyes of any who utter it in my presence."
To cause another's suffering, to delight in their pain, to extend their agony according to your whim. That is power.
This one delights in galloping across the steppes, feeling the cold wind in their face and the thunder of hooves beneath them.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This lord has received a blood-oath from another warrior. No matter the change to the winds of fortune, this warrior will remain loyal and fight alongside them.
This lord gives special care to their hunting dogs, treasuring the slavering beasts.
This leader has an eye for fine horseflesh, able to discern the best studs and mares from which to breed a herd.

effects.description:
Attribute: Glorious Charge for Feral Horse Herd
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Sturdy Steeds" for Feral Horse Herd
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Begone! I have no need for your gifts of airag and wine... In fact, perhaps I'd be better off without you altogether..."
This one holds great ambitions, coveting the authority of those above them.

effects.description: On turn start, Lords have a chance to gain -1 loyalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The Great Wolf howls amidst the thunder, his red lightning guiding my blade to fresh blood."

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "See this dung pile? Can you not see the Great Vulture's wisdom contained within?"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases as the unit takes damage

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The Great Eagle soars over all, spying out new pastures for the herds to roam."

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with Winds of Magic spent on the battlefield

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The Great Serpent tells me of great riches to the south, just waiting to be taken."

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases by each enemy unit in range with leadership wavering or lower.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one comes from the strange community of hunters that feast upon warped mutant flesh. This diet has had...unusual results.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one likes to hunt using the raptors native to the cliffs and crags of the Eastern Steppes.

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Large: +5 for Chaos Vultures
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This nomad is curious about the discoveries and innovations of foreign lands, and how to use them for war.
This one is an expert in the saddle, guiding their steed to such speeds that horse and rider seem to fly.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -20%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one has won countless bouts in the circle, proving themselves a champion of the tribes.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +25%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty
